net.tridentsdk.meta.block

Interface BlockMeta<T>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Meta<T>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    CauldronMeta, ChestMeta, ColorMeta, DirectionMeta, FurnaceMeta, SignMeta
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CauldronMetaImpl, ChestMetaImpl, ColorMetaImpl, DirectionMetaImpl, FurnaceMetaImpl, SignMetaImpl

    @ThreadSafe
public interface BlockMeta<T>
extends Meta<T>
    Represents a Meta object which is possessed by blocks
    Since:
    0.4-alpha
    Author:
    The TridentSDK Team

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Meta<T> decode(T instance, float yaw, byte direction, byte cx, byte cy, byte cz, short damageValue)
      Decodes the block meta
      default Meta<T> decodeMeta(T instance, byte[] data)
      In BlockMeta, the data always has 8 elements laid out like so: 0-1: Player yaw * 10 2: Block direction 3: Cursor x 4: Cursor y 5: Cursor z 6-7: item damage
      default Class[] dependencies()
      Used by the metadata compiler to order the specific metadata value before this one to preserve bit order
      byte encode()
      Encodes the block metadata into a single byte, which is then combined with the rest of the metadata
      default byte[] encodeMeta()
      In blocks, only one meta field byte is needed

      • Methods inherited from interface net.tridentsdk.meta.component.Meta

        applyTo, make

    • Method Detail

      • decodeMeta

        default Meta<T> decodeMeta(T instance,
                           byte[] data)
        In BlockMeta, the data always has 8 elements laid out like so:
        • 0-1: Player yaw * 10
        • 2: Block direction
        • 3: Cursor x
        • 4: Cursor y
        • 5: Cursor z
        • 6-7: item damage
        Specified by:
        decodeMeta in interface Meta<T>
        Parameters:
        instance - the data owner which the value will be applied upon
        data - the data
        Returns:
        the new meta instance

      • encodeMeta

        default byte[] encodeMeta()
        In blocks, only one meta field byte is needed
        Specified by:
        encodeMeta in interface Meta<T>
        Returns:
        the byte data

      • dependencies

        default Class[] dependencies()
        Used by the metadata compiler to order the specific metadata value before this one to preserve bit order
        Returns:
        the classes to have dependencies on

      • encode

        byte encode()
        Encodes the block metadata into a single byte, which is then combined with the rest of the metadata
        Returns:
        the byte data

      • decode

        Meta<T> decode(T instance,
               float yaw,
               byte direction,
               byte cx,
               byte cy,
               byte cz,
               short damageValue)
        Decodes the block meta
        Parameters:
        instance - the block instance
        yaw - the player yaw
        direction - the block direction
        cx - the cursor x
        cy - the cursor y
        cz - the cursor z
        damageValue - the item damage
        Returns:
        the new meta instance
